posts.author: WhiZard
posts.content:
Skill points are precious. When taking a skill it is usually recommended to maximize the skill so as to remain competitive with the environment. Below I have detailed a number of skills with earlier cut-off points which will still remain competitive. This is given as a range of diminishing returns based on the modified skill score (including equipment and spells). A build certainly does not need to invest in any of these skills, but rather it may be ill-suited to take too many ranks, especially if they can be used elsewhere.

Animal Empathy
Suggested cut-off: 26-36
At 26 most standard creatures will be succeeded against with a roll of one. At 36 all standard creatures and most PC animal companions will be dominated with a roll of one.

Craft Armor
Suggested cut-off: 27-40
At 27 the mithral shield can be crafted without chance of failure. At 40 a +20 full plate can be fully modified without chance of failure.

Craft Trap
Suggested cut-off: 25-44
At 25, can just barely craft a deadly gas trap and other traps are very likely to craft. At 44 all traps can be crafted without chance of failure

Craft Weapon
Suggested cut-off: 14-18
At 14 can modify any weapon and craft ironwood weapons without chance of failure. At 18 all weapons can be crafted without chance of failure.

Heal
Suggested cut-off: 15-34
At 15 most poisons and diseases are removed on a roll of one with full guarantee outside of combat (take 20). At 34 all poisons and diseases can be removed during combat.

Lore
Suggested cut-off: 20-55 (for this include lore bonus from identify (+13 for standard potion higher if the spell can be cast))
At 20 (7 + 13 from potion) can identify bland +5 gear. 55 is the highest for identification.

Perform
Suggested cut-off: 30-75
At 30 the bard/curse song affects 5AC (with 16 bard). At 75 it affects 6AC (with 25 bard). Intermediate scores have only a marginal effect.

Pick pocket
Suggested cut-off: 19-29
At 19 can automatically pick pocket neutrals with minimal spot investment. At 29 all pick pocket attempts will succeed (though they can still make the target hostile).

Search
Suggested cut-off: 34-46
At 34 a non-rogue has maxed his trap detection. At 46 a rogue can detect on a roll of one a deadly gas trap set by a player who barely made the skill roll with a take 20. There is no way to compete with PC set epic traps.

Set trap
Suggested cut-off: 15-45
At 15 can succeed on a take 20 for most deadly traps. At 45 can succeed on a take 20 for epic traps.

UMD
Suggested cut-off: 35-40
At 35 can use any scroll without chance of failure. At 40 can fully take advantage of a holy avenger with additional properties with a total value at 1,000,000 or less.
